column5: After a long break from my annual Canadian fishing trips I am planning a trip for 2016.I am looking for a drive to or boat to lake with lots of good Pike.Outpost camps very much preferred. Also we like places that promote conservation practices.Over the last several years we have seen this to be much needed for most lakes to sustain.We will cross at Sault Ste. Marie. Thanks for any help. Good Fishing, Pikeman

Congrats, hopefully your grandson catches the fishing bug and you two get to go for years to come. From reading these threads it seems many very important fishing traditions start with that first trip.

You might look at Chapleau Lodge. They don't have any outpost cabins, but they are the only lodge on Borden Lake. Prairie Bee is another option, it is a boat-in camp and has an outpost at the far end of the lake. Both lodges are about 200 miles NE of Sault Ste. Marie. I have never been to either of these camps, but they both look very nice. Good luck Â– Stu.

I was reading up on lodges this morning through the website www.onlinefishing.com Probably one of the most comprehensive sites I've seen regarding lodges and outposts located in Ontario. It includes approximate costs per person as well. PjShorthorn

Awesome taking your grandson! I don't know how far you want to drive, but 10 hours from Sault Ste. Marie is Sioux Lookout Ontario. Check Ghost River Lodge, they have a website. It is boat in, they bring you in on a boat. More pike and walleye than you can imagine.Karl

Thanks for all the help guys.It is good to get back on Walleye Central,its been a while.My Grandson is 12 years old and he is such a pleasure to spend time with.I am sure we will have a great time.My son is also going.He has been my best fishing buddy for about 46 years now and loves Canada as much as I do.Thanks again for all suggestions and Happy Fishing,Pikeman
